input: Claim: Vaccines cause infertility in young adults

quick_analysis.text: Manipulative framing detected: the claim uses fear-based language to target parents.
Similar falsehoods circulated during 2019 elections in Europe and India.
Scientific consensus confirms no evidence linking vaccines to infertility.

simple_explanation: This is like saying eating an apple changes your DNA. It sounds scary, but it's impossible according to science.
education_checklist: Compared against WHO and CDC reports

evidence.title: WHO Fact Sheet on Vaccine Safety
evidence.note: Confirms vaccines do not affect fertility.

evidence.title: BBC News Fact-Check
evidence.note: Debunked infertility claims spreading on WhatsApp.

deep_report.summary: The claim leverages fear about fertility, a recurring manipulation tactic...

sections.heading: Technical Analysis
sections.content: Biological evidence strongly contradicts any effect on fertility.

sections.heading: Psychological Perspective
sections.content: Fear-based rumors spread faster in parent communities online.

sections.heading: Geopolitical Context
sections.content: Similar narratives used in disinformation campaigns in Africa.
